summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the arraignment of Ghislaine Maxwell on the S2 Superseding Indictment. It details logistical arrangements for the public and victims to attend or listen to the proceeding, including COVID-19 protocols and teleconference access.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant scheduled for arraignment on the S2 Superseding Indictment in the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order regarding the arraignment logistics and public access.

events.title: Arraignment on S2 Superseding Indictment
events.description: Scheduled arraignment proceeding for Ghislaine Maxwell at 2:30 p.m. in Courtroom 24B of the Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse.

events.title: Deadline for Victim and Family Attendance Notification
events.description: Deadline for the Government and defense counsel to inform the Court whether alleged victims or the defendant's family members wish to attend the arraignment.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, NY
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment on the S2 Superseding Indictment was scheduled for April 23, 2021.
The court made special provisions for public and victim access, including an overflow video feed and a public teleconference line for up to 4,000 listeners.
Strict COVID-19 protocols were in place for courthouse entry, including a health questionnaire, temperature check, and specific mask requirements.
The government was ordered to notify the court if any alleged victims wished to attend, highlighting the court's attention to victim rights under 18 U.S.C. ยง 3771.
Defense counsel was similarly ordered to notify the court regarding the attendance of the defendant's family members.
